00045 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(engines, ast_speech_engine);
00046 static struct ast_speech_engine *default_engine = NULL;
00047 
00048 /*! \brief Find a speech recognition engine of specified name, if NULL then use the default one */
00049 static struct ast_speech_engine *find_engine(char *engine_name)
00050 {
00051    struct ast_speech_engine *engine = NULL;
00052 
00053    /* If no name is specified -- use the default engine */
00054    if (ast_strlen_zero(engine_name))
00055       return default_engine;
00056 
00057    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&engines);
00058    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&engines, engine, list) {
00059       if (!strcasecmp(engine->name, engine_name)) {
00060          break;
00061       }
00062    }
00063    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&engines);
00064 
00065    return engine;
00066 }

00068 /*! \brief Activate a loaded (either local or global) grammar */
00069 int ast_speech_grammar_activate(struct ast_speech *speech, char *grammar_name)
00070 {
00071    return (speech->engine->activate ? speech->engine->activate(speech, grammar_name) : -1);
00072 }
00073 
00074 /*! \brief Deactivate a loaded grammar on a speech structure */
00075 int ast_speech_grammar_deactivate(struct ast_speech *speech, char *grammar_name)
00076 {
00077    return (speech->engine->deactivate ? speech->engine->deactivate(speech, grammar_name) : -1);
00078 }
00079 
00080 /*! \brief Load a local grammar on a speech structure */
00081 int ast_speech_grammar_load(struct ast_speech *speech, char *grammar_name, char *grammar)
00082 {
00083    return (speech->engine->load ? speech->engine->load(speech, grammar_name, grammar) : -1);
00084 }
00085 
00086 /*! \brief Unload a local grammar from a speech structure */
00087 int ast_speech_grammar_unload(struct ast_speech *speech, char *grammar_name)
00088 {
00089    return (speech->engine->unload ? speech->engine->unload(speech, grammar_name) : -1);
00090 }

00092 /*! \brief Return the results of a recognition from the speech structure */
00093 struct ast_speech_result *ast_speech_results_get(struct ast_speech *speech)
00094 {
00095    return (speech->engine->get ? speech->engine->get(speech) : NULL);
00096 }
00097 
00098 /*! \brief Free a list of results */
00099 int ast_speech_results_free(struct ast_speech_result *result)
00100 {
00101    struct ast_speech_result *current_result = result, *prev_result = NULL;
00102    int res = 0;
00103 
00104    while (current_result != NULL) {
00105       prev_result = current_result;
00106       /* Deallocate what we can */
00107       if (current_result->text != NULL) {
00108          free(current_result->text);
00109          current_result->text = NULL;
00110       }
00111       if (current_result->grammar != NULL) {
00112          free(current_result->grammar);
00113          current_result->grammar = NULL;
00114       }
00115       /* Move on and then free ourselves */
00116       current_result = current_result->next;
00117       free(prev_result);
00118       prev_result = NULL;
00119    }
00120 
00121    return res;
00122 }
00123 
00124 /*! \brief Start speech recognition on a speech structure */
00125 void ast_speech_start(struct ast_speech *speech)
00126 {
00127 
00128    /* Clear any flags that may affect things */
00129    ast_clear_flag(speech, AST_SPEECH_SPOKE);
00130    ast_clear_flag(speech, AST_SPEECH_QUIET);
00131 
00132    /* If results are on the structure, free them since we are starting again */
00133    if (speech->results) {
00134       ast_speech_results_free(speech->results);
00135       speech->results = NULL;
00136    }
00137 
00138    /* If the engine needs to start stuff up, do it */
00139    if (speech->engine->start)
00140       speech->engine->start(speech);
00141 
00142    return;
00143 }
00144 
00145 /*! \brief Write in signed linear audio to be recognized */
00146 int ast_speech_write(struct ast_speech *speech, void *data, int len)
00147 {
00148    /* Make sure the speech engine is ready to accept audio */
00149    if (speech->state != AST_SPEECH_STATE_READY)
00150       return -1;
00151 
00152    return speech->engine->write(speech, data, len);
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*! \brief Change an engine specific attribute */
00156 int ast_speech_change(struct ast_speech *speech, char *name, const char *value)
00157 {
00158    return (speech->engine->change ? speech->engine->change(speech, name, value) : -1);
00159 }

00161 /*! \brief Create a new speech structure using the engine specified */
00162 struct ast_speech *ast_speech_new(char *engine_name, int format)
00163 {
00164    struct ast_speech_engine *engine = NULL;
00165    struct ast_speech *new_speech = NULL;
00166 
00167    /* Try to find the speech recognition engine that was requested */
00168    if (!(engine = find_engine(engine_name)))
00169       return NULL;
00170 
00171    /* Allocate our own speech structure, and try to allocate a structure from the engine too */
00172    if (!(new_speech = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*new_speech))))
00173       return NULL;
00174 
00175    /* Initialize the lock */
00176    ast_mutex_init(&new_speech->lock);
00177 
00178    /* Make sure no results are present */
00179    new_speech->results = NULL;
00180 
00181    /* Copy over our engine pointer */
00182    new_speech->engine = engine;
00183 
00184    /* We are not ready to accept audio yet */
00185    ast_speech_change_state(new_speech, AST_SPEECH_STATE_NOT_READY);
00186 
00187    /* Pass ourselves to the engine so they can set us up some more and if they error out then do not create a structure */
00188    if (engine->new(new_speech)) {
00189       ast_mutex_destroy(&new_speech->lock);
00190       free(new_speech);
00191       new_speech = NULL;
00192    }
00193 
00194    return new_speech;
00195 }
00196 
00197 /*! \brief Destroy a speech structure */
00198 int ast_speech_destroy(struct ast_speech *speech)
00199 {
00200    int res = 0;
00201 
00202    /* Call our engine so we are destroyed properly */
00203    speech->engine->destroy(speech);
00204 
00205    /* Deinitialize the lock */
00206    ast_mutex_destroy(&speech->lock);
00207 
00208    /* If results exist on the speech structure, destroy them */
00209    if (speech->results)
00210       ast_speech_results_free(speech->results);
00211 
00212    /* If a processing sound is set - free the memory used by it */
00213    if (speech->processing_sound)
00214       free(speech->processing_sound);
00215 
00216    /* Aloha we are done */
00217    free(speech);
00218 
00219    return res;
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*! \brief Change state of a speech structure */
00223 int ast_speech_change_state(struct ast_speech *speech, int state)
00224 {
00225    int res = 0;
00226 
00227    switch (state) {
00228    case AST_SPEECH_STATE_WAIT:
00229       /* The engine heard audio, so they spoke */
00230       ast_set_flag(speech, AST_SPEECH_SPOKE);
00231    default:
00232       speech->state = state;
00233       break;
00234    }
00235 
00236    return res;
00237 }
00238 
00239 /*! \brief Change the type of results we want */
00240 int ast_speech_change_results_type(struct ast_speech *speech, enum ast_speech_results_type results_type)
00241 {
00242    speech->results_type = results_type;
00243 
00244    return (speech->engine->change_results_type ? speech->engine->change_results_type(speech, results_type) : 0);
00245 }

00247 /*! \brief Register a speech recognition engine */
00248 int ast_speech_register(struct ast_speech_engine *engine)
00249 {
00250    struct ast_speech_engine *existing_engine = NULL;
00251    int res = 0;
00252 
00253    /* Confirm the engine meets the minimum API requirements */
00254    if (!engine->new || !engine->write || !engine->destroy) {
00255       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Speech recognition engine '%s' did not meet minimum API requirements.\n", engine->name);
00256       return -1;
00257    }
00258 
00259    /* If an engine is already loaded with this name, error out */
00260    if ((existing_engine = find_engine(engine->name))) {
00261       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Speech recognition engine '%s' already exists.\n", engine->name);
00262       return -1;
00263    }
00264 
00265    if (option_verbose > 1)
00266       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Registered speech recognition engine '%s'\n", engine->name);
00267 
00268    /* Add to the engine linked list and make default if needed */
00269    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&engines);
00270    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&engines, engine, list);
00271    if (!default_engine) {
00272       default_engine = engine;
00273       if (option_verbose > 1)
00274          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Made '%s' the default speech recognition engine\n", engine->name);
00275    }
00276    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&engines);
00277 
00278    return res;
00279 }
00280 
00281 /*! \brief Unregister a speech recognition engine */
00282 int ast_speech_unregister(char *engine_name)
00283 {
00284    struct ast_speech_engine *engine = NULL;
00285    int res = -1;
00286 
00287    if (ast_strlen_zero(engine_name))
00288       return -1;
00289 
00290    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&engines);
00291    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&engines, engine, list) {
00292       if (!strcasecmp(engine->name, engine_name)) {
00293          /* We have our engine... removed it */
00294          AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&engines, list);
00295          /* If this was the default engine, we need to pick a new one */
00296          if (!default_engine)
00297             default_engine = AST_RWLIST_FIRST(&engines);
00298          if (option_verbose > 1)
00299             ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Unregistered speech recognition engine '%s'\n", engine_name);
00300          /* All went well */
00301          res = 0;
00302          break;
00303       }
00304    }
00305    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
00306    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&engines);
00307 
00308    return res;
00309 }

00311 static int unload_module(void)
00312 {
00313    /* We can not be unloaded */
00314    return -1;
00315 }
00316 
00317 static int load_module(void)
00318 {
00319    return 0;
00320 }
00321 
00322 AST_MODULE_INFO(ASTERISK_GPL_KEY, AST_MODFLAG_GLOBAL_SYMBOLS, "Generic Speech Recognition API",
00323       .load = load_module,
00324       .unload = unload_module,
00325       );
